snippet: The Supreme Court, citing secret evidence of militant ties, refused to release two Palestinians held without charge and who have been on hunger strike for 69 days.
abstract: Israel's Supreme Court rejects appeals for the release of two Palestinian prisoners who have been on a hunger strike for 69 days to protest their incarceration without formal charges; rejection sharpens concerns for their lives and raises the specter of widespread unrest in the event of death.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court, citing secret evidence of militant ties, refused to release two Palestinians held without charge and who have been on hunger strike for 69 days.

headline.seo: Israeli Court Rejects Appeal for Palestinians’ Release
headline.main: Israeli Court Rejects the Release of Hunger Strikers
headline.print_headline: Israeli Court Rejects Release of 2 Detainees
